lexUnit.name: ominous.a

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: giving the worrying impression that something bad is going to happen.

sentence.text: These are both rather ominous examples of hidden agendas , because the reason for being secretive is because the real motive is essentially manipulative .
The Bowery looked ominous but I was n't afraid .
It was beginning to look ominous for the Light Blues , as the final bend favoured Oxford .
There seemed an ominous lack of broadcasting experience .
Relapses in high grade patients also seem to be ominous events as both patients who relapsed have died .
The press reports of Leeds games lately sound ominous for opposition everywhere .
The sunlight outside was dazzling , despite a bank of ominous dark clouds on the horizon .
The price also reflects the ominous presence of BellSouth which has tabled a rival offer for LIN .
It is suddenly free of that distinctly ominous presence and sees its opportunity .
There were ominous signs of crumbling in the heart of the Frankish kingdom assigned to Charles in 837 .
When he was transferred to Jakarta at the time of growing tension between Britain and Indonesia , there were ominous signs that action was intended against the British Embassy .
There was an ominous minute 's silence and then , even more ominously , Frau Nordern spoke .
There is an option for institutions to subscribe for shares in individual authorities but that comes with the ominous warning that there is no guarantee the shares will be available .
They welcomed Nottingham to the Recreation Ground and stuck 50 points on them , an ominous warning to everyone that it 's not just World Cup teams who can set new standards .
Then he was passing the metal door with the ominous warning sign , and felt a blast of searing heat from its paint-blistered exterior as he did so .
Katherine felt the hush in the room grow ominous in its waiting for her .

This ominous escalation of tension has come amid reports that the rail blockade of Armenia and Nagorny Karabakh by Azerbaijan -- partially lifted at least in recent days -- has been re-imposed after fresh violence .
Ominous thunder rolls threatened rain .
Her heart dropped at the ominous statement .
Only the weather was ominous -- the usual generous gestures of support received from congregation and friends were heartwarming .
However , the Minister 's silence is ominous and unfair on our farmers .
This is an ominous development since there is little doubt that Iran perceives the ballistic missile to be the delivery system of choice for nuclear weapons .
